trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when the server or the client cannot be reached for a previously specified period of time.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> is thrown when a remoting call does not complete in the specified timeout time.
<xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> uses the HRESULT COR_E_REMOTING, which has the value 0x8013150B.
<xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> uses the default <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> implementation, which supports reference equality.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException>, see the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> constructors.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException"></xref> class with default properties.
<xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> inherits from the <xref:System.Exception> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> class:
Property
Value
Localized error message for <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException>
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException"></xref> class with a specified message.
<xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> inherits from the <xref:System.Exception> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> class:
Property Type
Condition
The `message` string
The message that indicates the reason why the exception occurred.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception must include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> class:
Property
Value
The inner exception reference
The error message string
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
If the InnerException parameter is not `null`, the current exception is raised in a `catch` block that handles the inner exception.
